newsitem.title: USA: Cole Taylor deal gets conditional approval.
newsitem.headline: Cole Taylor deal gets conditional approval.

text.p: Cole Taylor Financial Group Inc said Tuesday that the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve Bank has given its conditional approval of a proposed split-off of Cole Taylor Bank to an investment group headed by Jeffrey Taylor, chairman of Cole Taylor Financial Group.

The approval requires that Taylor Capital Group secures necessary financing for the transaction. The split-off is expected to be completed by the first quarter of 1997, the company said in a statement.

Cole Taylor Financial Group is the holding company for Cole Taylor Bank and Reliance Acceptance Corp. The bank currently operates ten branches in Cook and DuPage counties in Illinois. Reliance Acceptance is a consumer finance company operating 46 branch offices in 16 states.
